      mount st helens being about to blow up

3.10.22  10:32 pm   what is a cool topic

3.10.22  8:03 pm   What should you do if the people around you tell you to give up on your biggest passion (music) because you annoy everyone around you with it? Normally, I wouldn't be so easy to give up, but after years and years it starts to seem true. I love music though, I'm not sure I even could give it up. Should I just keep it to myself instead? Sorry if you've answered this before, have a good day!

      keep it to yourself, AND, whenever you're ready, make it available for anyone to find, whenever they're ready

3.10.22  7:35 pm   I have just listened to "Fly Around" for the first time and it left me dancing around while crying at the same time. Bill your music is helping me understand who I am as an artist. My question: if there is something I've made that I don't like, should I just toss it and shift focus to something else I do like or should I challenge myself to turn it into something I do like?

      this can get very confusing........ i admit, this can seem very chaotic until you've made a system, based on what you seem to truly want most, and what you think is the most realistic way to best acheive that over time. which sometimes takes a long time to figure out, and i apologize for that. the good news for now is, you can make either choice and you're probably gonna be fine

      the first line

      basically all you have to do is convince someone who's listening to you that everything's gonna be ok. Surprisingly, no one's been able to really pin-down or prove any specific way of actually doing this. so, you may be the first

     only if X is 'no' or 'yes'. other variations of that would be extremely extremely rare

     Does this phrase apply to a lot of your life?

      no, but it applies to a lot of these questions

3.10.22  11:29 am   chord progression in the modulation at the end of 'fly around'? most notably 'melody is drifting into the future' thx bill xx

      i'm approximating, but see if this gets the job done:
     Fmin7   Eb/F   Db/Gb   B/E
     Bbmin7   Ebadd4/C  Fadd4/D   B/E    Dbsus2/Gb
     Dbmaj7/Eb

3.10.22  10:19 am   do you plan on making any short commentary videos this year (ex: wfaoie) or is releasing new music your top priority as of right now?

      all options are on the table

3.10.22  9:18 am   ever think about dabbling in microtonal music?

      it depends what you mean. If you mean using free range of pitch, yes please. that stuff's always an option, especially in percussion, vocal, and many other types of sounds. if you are talking specifically about an evenly divided 24-tone scale, or another evenly divided scale besides 12, (and i'm sorry for assuming this if you weren't talking about that! but on the off chance that you do mean that, then....) no i don't think i'll be using that

3.10.22  9:02 am   In one of your notes, you said 'not a boat.' was your prized possession but you never got to use it. Can you do it now?

      i used it in "hallelujah"

3.10.22  8:23 am   is there a story behind "i just did a bad thing"? if so,, what is it?

      i have 2 stories. one is about the way it was selected, and the other story is about the chorus almost being cancelled. For the song selection, i was using my standard song selection technique, which is to go through all my potential songs, and pick the ones i'm most excited about doing, and put them in a list. i came up with about 30 choices. THEN, this is where i made the mistake: i went around that final list a second time, to try to remove the ones i don't really want, and be left with only the best. The problem is, one by one i found reason to eliminate all of them. Maybe some of them felt too similar to a recent song.... maybe some of them felt too slow... maybe some of them felt too fast.... maybe some were too happy... maybe some of them felt like they would be too boring.... maybe some of them felt like they would be too crazy.... But i eliminated every single one. This is not what's supposed to happen. this is a fear driven situation i found myself in. Really, the important thing to remember when doing the song selection, is that truly any choice can work. Because most of the writing is still ahead, and the entire production is still ahead, and any song, if it's made it to that first list, it has more than good enonugh potential to be turned into something great. But here i was, being so particular that i had actually removed every song from the list. So, in a fit of rage, i un-removed all of them, and very quickly chose one that seemed like the weakest one, which was only 1 line at the time ("just did a bad thing"). Not knowing anything else about that song, which way it could go, not knowing what the 'bad thing' is, ... but it seemed to relate to the situation at hand, and i knew the antidote to this conundrum would be to choose something on a whim that was mostly unknown, just like this one. so that's why i made that choice. then i continued the writing from there, using my standard songwriting procedures and practices. The story behind the first chorus (the "game" section), is this: When i first launched into that section (coming up with half or maybe all of it), i was excited to have something like this, but then after a few more play-throughs i started to feel like that section really doesn't belong in this song. So i actually filed that away as a different song, and tried to continue forward (from 'cancelled') to see what else i can do instead. What else i found wasn't any better, so i eventually had to decide that the "game" section is the best option

3.10.22  8:18 am   So i understand that you have used capital letters before on this questions page, but how come you never sing in capital letters?

      that doesn't make sense

3.10.22  4:33 am   hi Bill, what are the chords that play under "My calender is telling me it's the future" in "fly around", they sounds very very nice

      "my calendar is telling me" will be fine with Asus2, plus the melody note of each moment. And on "future", that would be C#min add 2
